translated: Bergström, Enik Ingvar, associate professor, PhD, Gothenburg, born December 16, 1913, in Gothenburg to sea captain Erik O. B. and Dagmar Söron. Married in 1935 to Adie Elizabeth Lundell who has a degree in philosophy. They have one child, Lisbeth born in 1937. Bergström studied at Gothenburg high school from 1932-34, received a degree in philosophy in 1934, a research degree in 1939, and a doctorate in philosophy in 1947, all from Gothenburg University. Bergström has studied abroad in Italy, Germany, Austria, France, the Netherlands, Belgium, and England. He worked as an assistant curator at Gothenburg Art Museum in 1935 and was an assistant curator at the Röhsska Museum of Applied Art and Design in Gothenburg from 1937-1946. Bergström was a commissioner for a large number of art exhibitions, including the Swedish Housing Fair in Copenhagen in 1946. He became an associate professor in the history of art and art theory at Gothenburg University in 1947. Bergström was the chairman of the Swedish-Dutch Association in Gothenburg since 1943, the chairman of the Gothenburg Artisans Association from 1944-1946, and the secretary of the Swedish-Italian Association in Gothenburg since 1944. He has written several works including "Dutch still life painting during the 17th century" (academic dissertation, 1947) and articles and papers on art and industry. He is a member of the National Association of Danish Arts and Crafts and Industrial Arts.
